storyInfo: It is not divine revelation that brings enlightenment to the devout, but the obsessions of man. Salvation does not come from trading faith for blessings, but from earning the right to save oneself, through commitment to one's beliefs.

attributes.content: Obsession, is it?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This is your obsession.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: What's wrong with a little obsession?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I don't care if it's irrational, meaningless, or futile - when I make up my mind to do something, I do it!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Why do you think we fight?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Those empty platitudes of yours - did you think they weren't a form of obsession too?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Why are each of us here, if not for our own obsessions?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: A shot rings out.
However, the target was not Andoain.
Before he realizes it, his gun had left his hand.
But he feels at ease.
For his gun will forever remain in Laterano.
He may never say it, but how can anyone help but love Laterano?
Those peaceful days, those joyful times, those happy moments.
But because of this 'love', he has had regrets, guilt, shame, and doubts.
He may never become a true Lateran.
But in this moment, when he thinks about his gun staying here forever...
At this very moment, under the glare of the faces looking at him...
A kind of peace floats to the surface like a bubble, then pops.
He walked ten thousand miles on the path of faith and doubt.
From one path to the next.
He thought he was wandering the wilderness, far from his roots.
But perhaps this was not true.
In more ways than one.
He whispered a word of gratitude.
No one will ever hear it, not in the past, present, or future.
But it was enough.
Finally. I thought maybe you had dozed off.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Come on, cut me some slack. It's hard finding a good sniping vantage point.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: This is it, Andoain. Hands up—
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: (Whispers) Here... out of obsession...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Watch out!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: How does he still have enough strength left for Arts?!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: How could one find salvation alone?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No, not salvation, but a life with dignity.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You come before me because of your sense of justice, and I arrived here because of mine.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It comes to myth, to obsession, to the ultimately futile crossing... the path was always beneath my feet.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Why do we place our hopes on salvation? What we have done is not for the sake of salvation.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But to save ourselves.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Have you come to your senses, Andoain? Then look me in the eye—I felt like I was shooting a target dummy.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I'll walk my own path, whether this is my mission or not.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I must thank you, Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You're welcome. I'll be sure to tell your friends about this epiphany at your funeral.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: As for right now, you're—
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I'm afraid it's not yet time for that. I still have a use for him.
Someone blew up one of the support beams. We need to go!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Who the—?!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: The explosion was approved. I personally submitted the application and stamped it myself.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Oren! Why you—!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: What are you doing, Oren? Is this what you came to do?
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Welp, cat's out of the bag.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: (Go, Andoain. I'll find you later.)
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Fiammetta, Mostima... perhaps we'll meet again.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Wheresoever that may be, let us hold onto our obsessions.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: For as you say, they are why we exist.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Please, miss, I must ask you to come down from the signboard.
attributes.name: Hotel Manager

attributes.content: I'll have to call the Guards if you don't comply.
attributes.name: Hotel Manager

attributes.content: But while we're at it, I just have to know.
attributes.name: Hotel Manager

attributes.content: How on Terra did you get up there with a wheelchair?
attributes.name: Hotel Manager

attributes.content: Where there's a will, there's a way.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That dust cloud... another explosion? There's been too many of those lately. It's starting to seem more like a fireworks show than a conference.
attributes.name: Hotel Manager

attributes.content: Um, excuse me? Could you give me a hand?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Sometimes it's easier to get up than to get down.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You must be joking! What is wrong with Laterano's crisis management? That explosion damaged my collection! I demand an explanation!
attributes.name: Angry Ambassador

attributes.content: The Lateran bells are ringing for the first time in a thousand years? Was this prepared by His Holiness as a special welcome for us?
attributes.name: Impatient Ambassador

attributes.content: Being with you barbarians is too much to bear. If not for my respect for His Holiness, I'd—
attributes.name: Hesitant Ambassador

attributes.content: Tell the cook to prepare dinner. I refuse to attend another Lateran banquet.
attributes.name: Elegant Ambassador

attributes.content: Can these people really bring change? Most of them are opportunists, at best.
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Yes. This is something that only Laterano can do - Laterano, the city of miracles, forever fair and just.
attributes.name: The Pope

attributes.content: Your Holiness... I will pray for us.
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Rare to see you so nervous, Velliv.
attributes.name: The Pope

attributes.content: I'm too old for parlor tricks. All I can do is to keep walking, as far as I can.
attributes.name: The Pope

attributes.content: Your Holiness, the broadcast is ready.
attributes.name: Friar

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: The Pope

attributes.content: Let my words and deeds honor my name and title.
attributes.name: The Pope

attributes.content: Greetings, honored guests. I am Yvangelista XI, and I welcome you on behalf of Laterano.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: We are facing a great challenge, one that threatens not just Laterano, but all nations across Terra.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: As you know, our countries are built on the backs of nomadic cities.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Indeed, the advent of such cities established the very concept of the modern nation state.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: In the past, a state was simply a gathering of people of similar lifestyles, huddled together for safety in the face of Catastrophe. 'National borders' were simply whatever lay within their sights.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: This all changed with the birth of nomadic cities.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: As is the human condition, conflict began to arise as these states interacted with each other.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Perhaps even the word 'conflict' is an understatement.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: I saw the fall of Gaul with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The 'Capital of the World' fell overnight. Armored battleships went silent, and the Old Vanguard of Gaul was reduced to ash.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: But it was more than Gaul that fell that night. It was the fall of civilization itself.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: All the might of the Gaulish Emperor and his legions could not save an empire that once stood proudly as the center of all lands.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: What, then, could possibly preserve our own civilization, that the people of Terra have painstakingly built, piece by piece, under the dark cloud of Catastrophe?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Laterano gave much for the war that engulfed the entire continent. Our Messengers crossed both the wilderness and the royal courts, building Laterano's reputation.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The Sankta heard your calls for peace.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: But our lands had seen too many shades of this so-called peace, pooling in the dark corners of castles, palaces, and tents.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: We've seen the birth of secrets, meant only to benefit a select few, that lie in wait to undermine peace and order when least expected.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The old wars of conquest may be a distant memory, but in their place we have tacit understandings and secret dealings, that determine the fates of lives and nations from out of sight.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Today though, Revelation has come.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: It is my hope that the process of building peace be transparent from the very start. That we will all reject secret agreements between the few.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: There are questions that anyone who does not cling to the past, anyone who is concerned about the future of this land, should be asking.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: How do we ensure the survival of civilization?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: How many people are endangered when peace is threatened?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: What does safety for one country mean for the safety of other countries?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Civilization is key to survival. Peace is something to be shared with others, not hoarded for oneself.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: As such, I call for the establishment of an accord of mutual assurance between nations.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: We have far more common interests than many would imagine.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Terra must stand together, or fall together.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.text: Yvangelista XI's speech on March 18th, 1099, later known as the 'Lateran Declaration,' is quoted on the first page of every edition of the International Summit Handbook.
